DataElement.preferredName: Adapted WLQ Past 4 Weeks How Much of the Time Did Caregiving Responsibilities Make it Difficult to Help Other People to Get Work Done Difficulty 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much of the time their caregiving responsibilities made it difficult for them to help other people to get work done, using a 6 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Change WLQ Past 4 Weeks How Much of the Time Did Caregiving Responsibilities Make it Difficult to Help Other People to Get Work Done
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character._A standardized rating scale originally developed by Lerner et al in 1998. This instrument is used to measure the degree to which health problems interfere with specific aspects of job performance and health-related productivity loss in employed individuals._A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present._A question about how much of the time something is occurring or has occurred._A question about if an individual's caregiving responsibilities made it difficult to help other people to get work done.
